column4: hii! did anyone find out why does ubuntu dapper freeze in parallels?
(I've heard live cd works, but proper install does not)
ah, pcmcia issues
how do I disable kernel's pcmcia support then? :)
blacklist the modules
pcmcia is modulized in Ubuntu. blacklisting the modules will turn it off
work for what?
it will give you a root prompt and not start any services
ubuntu hangs for me at 'Uncompressing Linux... OK, booting the kernel'
oh
what makes you think it's due to pcmcia?
some basic googling
it could be caused be a gazillion things
people used livecd to successfully install, and all failed with proper iso
sure, esp. being installed on a virtual machine :)
heh yes maybe so
it installs just the basic system. no X or anything
the kernel is the same
it should be called minimal I think
it doesn't even install any server programs
it was annoying, having to run lilo at every change of lilo.conf or it would have any effect
more annoying part was 'LI'
oh yes that one too
